We recently upgraded from Confluence 5.1.4 to 5.4.3 and now some of our more complex pages and templates are broken. We've isolated the issue down to the number of sub-nested macros. To recreate the issue do the following:

Create a page with 35 Info macros on after another = no problem
Create a page with 35 info macros continually nested inside of each other and the page will timeout after 2 minutes trying to save. (Page not found error).

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-35356].
  {panel}

Currently, blueprint templates can be set Globally or for a specific Space.

However, users might not be aware of this. A tooltip or a String of text of some sort in {{Confluence Admin >> Global Templates and Blueprints}} would be great to let other user's know of the existence of Space specific blueprints.

This is because a Space with multiple administrator could have edited one of the default template and change the look of it and other administrator might not be aware of it.

After that another Space administrator is unaware of this changes might want a different layout and he/she went to Global blueprint to change the default template and Create a page with that particular blueprint on that Space and he/she gets a different result as what he/she have done without being aware that the Global template is actually being overridden by the Space blueprint template. 

This will eliminate that confusion to Confluence administrators.
fields.summary: update string to let users know about the existence of Space specific blueprints

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-35351].
  {panel}

Make a view for page/page-tree organization that allows documentation experts to easily re-organize where pages are located.

Right now it seems that it's only possible to organize pages by going to the page itself and re-assigning it's parent page.  While this is functional, it can be very difficult to work with when you have hundreds of documents that need to put into a proper location.  This problem is compounded when you're doing "clean up" work and are not even sure where you are going to put said pages.

The great thing about an explorer style view (folders/sub-folders) is that you can quickly create a few basic folders simply to start putting documents into broad categories.  Then you can go into those folders and break them down further.  It's great when you can do this in real time, but if we can't drag and drop and instead have to go to the page and find the parent we want to give it...  It becomes cumbersome.

So if we could have an explorer view for organization, that would be great.
fields.summary: Explorer view for page organization

The page properties report macro had a bug in it - CONF-30125 - where it would display pages without regard to the privacy of the page itself.

While this is a security risk, there are customers who've come to rely on this functionality. For example, one customer uses it to display the overall status of a project, without exposing the particulars of a project to the whole of their staff.

After the bug was fixed in CONF-30125, reports only displayed items that the viewer had access to - which causes problems for customers who were relying on it's previous behaviour.

It would be nice if there was an option to "impersonate" a user - that is, to list pages that the _impersonated_ user could see (rather than the viewer); along with the appropriate notice that it is a security risk.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-35291].
{panel}
{panel:title=Status Update 26 October 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ff7f7f|titleBGColor=#ff7f7f|bgColor=#e5e5e5}
We reviewed this bug and could see that actual root cause is coming from the fact that no "space key" is chosen when adding "create from template" macro to a Global template.

Details of the issue are submitted to the new bug:
 https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-70992

*New workaround :*
 # Create / edit a Global template
 # Add "create from template" macro
 # *Make sure to add "space key" at the bottom left of the macro edit form. After that "template name" drop-down will be available.*
 # *Once you create a new page based on the global template, you will need to click "edit" button for "create from template" macro to have space key updated correctly.*{panel}
h3. Current Behaviour

When creating or editing a Global Template and trying to add the ‘Create from template’ Macro the macro editor hangs. Dropdowns aren't responsive.
 !Screen Shot 2014-10-16 at 8.38.41 PM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Error message

404 error is thrown in the browser console:
 !Screen Shot 2014-10-15 at 9.23.20 PM.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround
 # edit regular (non-template) Confluence page and add the ‘Create from template’ Macro to it;
 # copy the macro from the page editor;
 # edit a Global Template and past the macro copied in previous step;
 # save the template - the macro button will work as expected.

h3. Note

If user language is not English, the workaround won't work.
fields.summary: Unable to add ‘Create from template’ Macro to a Global Template

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-35285].
  {panel}

h2. Summary
Slowness Rendering a Page with the 'Section' Macro

h2. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Page
# Select the 'Edit' option from the top right menu
# type ‘{section’ to bring up the section macro and select it
# Enter information in the ‘Section’ macro.  (I saw the degradation grow as multiple items were added, but over 100 items is very noticeable)
# Save the page (should be slow)
# Navigate away and back to the page (should be slow)

*If the same information is entered on a page without the section macro, it renders without speed degradation.* 

h2. Expected Result
The page would render normally and not take a noticeable amount of time to do so

h2. Actual Result
- The page takes a noticeable amount of time to render
- In Confluence Cloud any text that does not render within a section column within 60 seconds will be truncated from the page (Location of text is random within document)
-- Effects are compounded if using firefox with FireBug enabled

h2. Environment
Confluence 5.4.4

h2. Other Notes
* I have attached a Storage format of a page that has many items (so that it is easier to recreate by adding through source editor)
* If you remove the data from the Section macro, the page renders very quickly.  That is reason for submitting this as a bug as it seems to be an issue with the ‘Section’ Macro itself
* Only tested on Confluence 5.4.4 and 5.6.3.  Issue is present in both.
fields.summary: Slowness Rendering a Page with the 'Section' Macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-35196].
{panel}
h3. Summary

Our [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/JIRA+Issues+Macro] states the following "_You can include any columns recognized by your JIRA site, including custom columns_", however when including a JIRA Macro issue in a Confluence page , original estimate and including the fields {{[work ratio|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA041/Searching+for+Issues#SearchingforIssues-Usingthe%27WorkRatio%27section]}},  time spent, total remaining estimate or {{progress}} the value of those fields is not displayed.

This affects JIRA Service Desk "Time to resolution" and "Time to first response".
h3. Customer Impact
 * Inaccurate data shown on Confluence pages

h3. Environment
 * Confluence Cloud (old and new editor)

h3. Steps to Reproduce

  {panel}

This is not so much a "new feature" as much as a plea to restore an old feature.

In Confluence 5.1 (and earlier?) you used to be able to limit a search to *Site Spaces* ... i.e. exclude Personal Spaces.    (There was also the option to search only *Personal Spaces*, but this was not nearly as useful.)

Somewhere between Confluence 5.1 and 5.5, *Site Spaces* was removed as an option.

This was a very important feature because pages in Personal Spaces have a bad habit of bubbling to the top of search results, and they are rarely the desired result.   Being able to simply _exclude_ those pages, caused an immediate improvement to the search results.  

In fact, I contend it should have been -- or been settable as -- the default behavior.
fields.summary: Restore the ability to search for Site Spaces (exclude Personal Spaces)

When working in Confluence there used to be the possibility to create tasks without being in edit mode of a page. In order to get this funtionality back here the UserStory/Featurerequest:

I as +ProductOwner working with Confluence+ want the possibility to +add tasks to pages without being in the "edit" mode+ of a page in order to be +quicker while discussing several pages (User Stories)+ with the Team or future Users.

Description:
* Ideally I would write a comment using @user//duedate and select anything indicating, that this is a task, that should be created.
* The tasks should have a connection to the page, where I added the comment/task
* If the task is assigned to a user, it should appear on a users personal task list
* The task should show up in an overview for the page/pagetree/space, that contains the relevant tasks (could in a first step be realised with the "task report plugin").

Tests:
write "@user//duedate: add this task to the page" in a comment to a page and indicate as task
--> the task shows up on top of the page (not necessarily within the page content)
--> the task is shown in the "task tab" of the @user
--> the task is shown in a "task tab" of the space (new tab for spacedetails) with reference to the page

write "add this task to the page" in a comment to a page and indicate as task
--> the task shows up on top of the page (not necessarily within the page content)
--> the task is shown in a "task tab" of the space (new tab for spacedetails) with reference to the page

write "@user//duedate: add this task to the page" in a comment and DO NOT indicate as task
--> comment is not shown on top of page
--> comment is not in personal tasklist of @user
--> comment is not shown in "task tab" of the space
fields.summary: Enable tasks to be created without editing a page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-35180].
  {panel}

When opening dashboard, the methods below slow down in our customer environment.
* LabelManager.getLabel()
* SpaceManager.getPersonalSpace()

Just after rebooting, it takes 10-20ms to process each methods, but, after a while, it takes around 100ms.

We survey this issue and find that this phenomenon could be due to flushEntity of Hibernate.

* FlushEntity of Hibernate is quickly enough, but sometimes declines in some degree by elapsed time or memory state.(decline around several tens of micro seconds )
* In Confluence, flushMode of Hibernate is configured AUTO and flushEntity is executed when refering.
* FlushEntities calling flushEntity called 11 times when certain user accessed the dashboard.
(i) FlashEntity means the method of SessionImpl. https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/hibernate-2.1.8/src/2366a6e6e48fa7ad8c1c509a9c87fb9811946113/src/net/sf/hibernate/impl/SessionImpl.java?at=master#cl-2492
* Our customer's confluence has a large amount of spaces (The number of Personal space is 4000 and total space is 5000).

They display Favorite spaces on their dashboard.
We confirmed that the value of flushEntity could be changed depending on the order which sort space table by spacename, spacekey and appear at interval of 500, during that process.
The result of the following SQL seems to be the flush.
{code}
select space0_.SPACEID as SPACEID, space0_.SPACENAME as SPACENAME, space0_.SPACEKEY as SPACEKEY, space0_.SPACEDESCID as SPACEDES4_, space0_.HOMEPAGE as HOMEPAGE, space0_.CREATOR as CREATOR, space0_.CREATIONDATE as CREATION7_, space0_.LASTMODIFIER as LASTMODI8_, space0_.LASTMODDATE as LASTMODD9_, space0_.SPACETYPE as SPACETYPE, space0_.SPACESTATUS as SPACEST11_, space0_.SPACEGROUPID as SPACEGR12_ from SPACES space0_ order by space0_.SPACENAME , space0_.SPACEKEY limit 2000, 500;
{code}

In our customer's dashboard, it took 330ms(30ms x 11) to process this flushEntity and Peformance regression seemed to be occurred by slowing due to memory state.

This issue is similar to the following problem of Hibernate.
* https://hibernate.atlassian.net/browse/HHH-2399
* http://stackoverflow.com/questions/10143880/hibernate-queries-much-slower-with-flushmode-auto-until-clear-is-called
fields.summary: Hibernate queries much slower with FlushMode.AUTO

At this moment JIRA does have an APi that allows to trigger a check of all plugins updates that are available and trigger their download and upgrade.
Providing an API for performing this would be of a great importance as it would allow to automate the upgrade of JIRA instances, and even scheduling these updates at times of low load.
At this moment this operation can be done only manually so it cannot be automated.
Also by having an automated upgrade option, this would allow to keep the staging / testing instances with bleeding age versions, allowing to test the effect of the new software versions over instances, preventing problems and downtimes on production instances.

  {panel}

All user management features are missing from Confluence 5.6.3 (also 5.6 and 5.6.1) if an OnDemand instance with the "user management" dark feature is imported.

h3. Reproduction steps:
# Export an OnDemand instance that has the unified user management dark feature enabled
# Restore this XML backup to Confluence 5.6.3
# Log in to the Confluence admin console
# User link and Group link should both be missing, user management is also missing from the cog.

h3. Expected behavior
User management links should be visible to admins in the Confluence admin console and the cog

h3. Actual behavior
User management links are not visible to admins in the Confluence admin console and the cog
!ugAdmin.png|thumbnail! !umCog.png|thumbnail!

h3. Related Notes
* These sections are accessible using the direct url, it is just the links in the left hand menu and the cog that are missing
* Only affects Confluence 5.6 and above

h3. Workaround
# The user and group management areas can be accessed directly via url:
** Users: <base_url>/admin/users/showallusers.action
** Groups: <base_url>/admin/users/browsegroups.action
# Try to disable the dark feature:
## Log into Confluence with an user with administrator permissions.
## Go to the URL <base_url>/admin/darkfeatures.action
## Click on remove by the entry unified.usermanagement.
# Or you can use the following SQL to disable the dark feature. The Confluence cache will need to be flushed, and the links will reappear.
{code:sql}delete from BANDANA where BANDANAKEY = 'confluence.darkfeature';{code}
fields.summary: User and Group Links Missing from Admin Console After Migrating From OnDemand to Confluence 5.6.x

It would be incredibly useful if the date format of the Date Lozenge could be customized. Currently, it looks like the only way to display the date is the dd-mm-yyyy format. This causes problems when attempting to sort Date Lozenges that display in either a table or in a Page Properties Report macro. It sorts the day then the month then the year. Thus we end up with:

16 Sept 2014
17 Aug 2014
18 January 2013

I realize most of the world does put dates in the logical order (dd-mm-yyyy), but the US is behind on this unique concept, so I often have people asking me if the date can be changed or if they can put the date in as mm-dd-yyyy instead.

I see two ways of fixing this:

# Allow Confluence admins to specify the date format the Date Lozenge and allow users to enter the date as mm-dd-yyyy.
# Correct the sorting of the Date Lozenge in the dd-mm-yyyy format so it sorts correctly by Year, Month, then Day in tables and the Page Properties Macro.
fields.summary: Date Lozenge Date Format and Sorting

When creating a new page, or copying a existing one

+Repro Steps:+
* For a new page:
*# Create a new page.
*# Add some content, including links to pages in the same space.
*# Click on the _Location_ button and change the location of the page to another space.
*# Save the page.
* For an existing page
*# Visualize a page with links to other pages.
*# Click on _Tools_ > _Copy_.
*# Click on the _Location_ button and change the location of the page to another space.
*# Save the page.

In both cases, the links to the pages are broken and they lead you to the creation of a new page with the same title than the one specified for the link.

I would expect Confluence to update the links to pages when changing the location of a page. This is what happens when you click on the _Move_ button.
fields.summary: Modifying location of a page may break links to pages in the content
